programme.title: NBA Courtside
programme.desc: Players get prepared for the upcoming game through their warm-up routines, as cameras go around the arena to see the fans get excited with tipoff nearing and capture the pregame energy before the starting five lineups are announced.

programme.title: NBA Today
programme.desc: A panel of NBA analysts discuss the latest news and developing stories across the league involving rumors and speculated player movement, including interviews with current players, team personnel and league insiders, as the trade deadline approaches.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Oklahoma City claimed wins over Phoenix in all three of their meetings in 2023-24, including the final matchup on March 29, 128-103, led by Josh Giddey's 23 points and 9 assists; Kevin Durant posted 26 points and 6 rebounds for the Suns in the loss.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: Oklahoma City claimed wins over Phoenix in all three of their meetings in 2023-24, including the final matchup on March 29, 128-103, led by Josh Giddey's 23 points and 9 assists; Kevin Durant posted 26 points and 6 rebounds for the Suns in the loss.

programme.title: NBA Basketball
programme.desc: San Antonio claimed a 133-126 overtime win over Atlanta in their first meeting of the season on Dec. 19 behind Victor Wembanyama's 42 points and 6 rebounds; the Hawks' De'Andre Hunter posted 27 points while Trae Young added 16 assists in the loss.

programme.title: The Pat McAfee Show
programme.desc: Former NFL punter Pat McAfee and his friends deliver one-of-a-kind opinions on the latest news making headlines in sports and entertainment, along with special segments and guest interviews with some of the biggest names to give a unique experience.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Connecticut and Tennessee last met in 2023, where the Huskies claimed an 84-67 victory over the Volunteers behind 26 points from Lou Lopez Sénéchal and 25 from Aaliyah Edwards; Jordan Horston posted 27 points and 7 rebounds for Tennessee in the loss.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: Mike Greenberg, who joined ESPN in 1996 as an anchor, joins former NBA star Jalen Rose for roundtable discussions about the latest sports news making headlines as well as analysis of recent big games and interviews with expert commentators.

programme.desc: Washington State (15-9, 5-6) dropped its last four games, but won the last five meetings, including a 64-58 road win last season; Oregon State (16-7, 6-4) is 13-1 at home behind Michael Rataj, who is third in the WCC in scoring with 17.9 ppg.

programme.title: ESPN Original Documentaries

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Temple (14-8, 6-3) won five of its last seven games behind Jamal Mashburn Jr., who is second in the country with 22.1 ppg; USF (11-11, 4-5) is 8-2 at home, and won both meetings with the Owls last season, including a 76-68 home win.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Saint Mary's (20-3, 10-0) won its last 11 meetings with the Dons after a 71-51 win on Jan. 23 behind 24 points from Paulius Murauskas; San Francisco (18-6, 8-3) is 14-0 at home behind Malik Thomas, who leads the WCC with 19.7 ppg.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Analysts preview the UFC 312 card and the main event as Dricus Du Plessis (22-2) defends his middleweight title against Sean Strickland (29-6); other matches include: Zhang Weili (25-3) defending her strawweight title against Tatiana Suarez (11-0).

programme.title: Women's College Gymnastics
programme.desc: LSU claimed a 198.325-197.325 victory over Alabama in their lone meeting from the 2024 season on March 1, led by a perfect score from Haleigh Bryant on floor; the Tigers closed out the final rotation on floor with a 49.775 to secure the win.

programme.title: Jimmy Houston OutDoors
programme.desc: Jimmy Houston travels on a fishing expedition to Argentina in hopes of finding trophy-caliber golden dorado, discussing the equipment he is using on the trip and his techniques in finding success out on the water with these tough fish.

programme.title: 30 for 30 Shorts
programme.desc: Hand games have become a staple of young Black girls dating back generations, as the documentary traces the history of the games and the influence they have had on pop culture and the creative landscape, including music, dance and style.

programme.title: Speak
programme.desc: The daily sports talk show delivers a compelling, informative and passionate filter to the top sports stories of the day as the host engages in lively discussions, debates and disagreements over the day's news, and no topic is off limits.

programme.desc: Breaking down the biggest sports news of the day along with various unique segments that help the host present his opinions on sports; players, coaches and celebrities are interviewed and discuss trending topics happening around the world.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Butler (9-13, 2-9) seeks its first road win, starting 0-6, but beat the Pirates, 82-77, on Jan. 15 behind Pierre Brooks II after losing the previous six meetings; Seton Hall (6-16, 1-10) dropped seven straight since beating DePaul, 85-80, on Jan. 8.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Colorado State (14-7, 8-2) won four-straight games; New Mexico (18-4, 10-1) is 11-1 at home, and defeated the Rams, 76-68, on Dec. 28 behind 14 points from Mustapha Amzil and Donovan Dent, who leads the Mountain West in scoring with 19.4 ppg.

programme.desc: Former football players break down the latest sports news making headlines across the country, giving a unique perspective from the athletes point of view on results of some of the recent marquee matchups and the stories impacting their league.

programme.desc: The cultural importance of sports is examined through the exploration of various athletes' journeys through life, both on and off the field, including the challenges, change and unity that sports are able to bring to different communities.

programme.title: Women's College Basketball
programme.desc: Seton Hall claimed victories over Xavier in both of their meetings from the 2023-24 season, winning the final matchup on Feb. 10 with an 86-62 scoreline; Savannah Catalon posted 21 points and 6 assists for the Pirates in the win at home.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: San Jose State (12-12, 5-7) won five of its last seven; Boise State (16-7, 8-4) is 10-1 at home, and is 41-4 vs. the Spartans after a 73-71 win on Dec. 28 behind 26 points from Tyson Degenhart, who is top five in Mountain West scoring at 17.7 ppg.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: USC (13-9, 5-6) is 3-2 on the road this season; No. 7 Purdue (18-5, 10-2) won three straight after a 90-81 victory over Iowa, and is 11-1 at home this season behind Trey Kaufman-Renn, who leads the Boilermakers in scoring with 18.7 ppg.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Teams compete in the 54-hole, season-opening event, as golfers play under the lights at night for a $25 million purse in the first-ever LIV Golf tournament held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia; Jon Rahm (individual) and Ripper GC (team) won 2024 titles.

programme.desc: Coverage of college basketball games.

PBA Bowling
programme.desc: Top contenders Kyle Troup, Anthony Simonsen, Jason Belmonte, EJ Tackett and Bill O'Neill featured in the 2024 U.S. Open's championship round; Graham Fach comes off of returning to the winner's circle at the Delaware Classic in Middletown, Delaware.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: The biggest sports stories and rumors of the week are covered, as the analysts break down the news surrounding each of the headlines to discuss how those involved will be impacted, along with guest interviews to get an intriguing look at sports.

programme.title: Magnify
programme.desc: The disappearance of quarterback Tom Brady's jersey after leading the New England Patriots' epic comeback to beat the Atlanta Falcons in Super Bowl LI is chronicled, which includes exclusive conversations with Brady and the man who stole the jersey.

programme.title: The Herd with Colin Cowherd: Super Bowl Special
College Basketball
programme.desc: Creighton (16-6, 9-2) won seven straight, including an 84-64 win over the Friars on Jan. 14 behind a double-double from Ryan Kalkbrenner, who is third in Big East scoring and second in rebounding; Providence (11-11, 5-6) is 9-2 at home this season.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: Colorado State (14-7, 8-2) won four-straight games; New Mexico (18-4, 10-1) is 11-1 at home, and defeated the Rams, 76-68, on Dec. 28 behind 14 points from Mustapha Amzil and Donovan Dent, who leads the Mountain West in scoring with 19.4 ppg.

programme.title: Coupe de France
programme.desc: Bourgoin's last action was a round of 32 win over Lyon on Jan. 15 after penalties of a 2-2 draw in which Mehdi Moujetzky had a brace; Reims beat Monaco through penalties after a 1-1 draw on Jan. 14 where Cédric Kipré opened the scoring for Reims.

programme.title: NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Two-time Daytona 500 winner Bobby Allison picked up his fifth win at the 2.5-mile oval in the Firecracker 400 the previous year, as Bobby and his son, Davey, would make history in the 30th running of the prestigious NASCAR race.

programme.title: Pro Volleyball Federation
programme.desc: Indy claimed a 3-2 victory over Columbus in their first meeting of the season on Jan. 18, led by a 29-kill, 18-dog performance from outside hitter Leketor Member-Meneh; Fury outside hitter Raina Terry posted 22 kills and 13 digs in the loss.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Teams compete in the 54-hole, season-opening event, as golfers play under the lights at night for a $25 million purse in the first-ever LIV Golf tournament held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia; Jon Rahm (individual) and Ripper GC (team) won 2024 titles.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series heads to Bowman Gray Stadium in Winston-Salem, North Carolina for the first of two exhibition races in the 2025 season; Bowman Gray Stadium is back to hosting the NASCAR Cup Series for the first time since 1971.

programme.title: NASCAR Cup Series
programme.desc: The NASCAR Cup Series heads to Bowman Gray Stadium in Winston-Salem, North Carolina for the first of two exhibition races in the 2025 season; Bowman Gray Stadium is back to hosting the NASCAR Cup Series for the first time since 1971.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Mexican side Tigres UANL is unbeaten in each of the two all-time meetings with El Tren del Norte after the teams played to a 1-1 draw at Estadio Independencia on Sept. 18; Real Estelí has lost three of its last four CONCACAF Champions Cup contests.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Mexican club Monterrey has won five titles since 2010 after defeating rival Club América in the final of the 2021 edition, 1-0, while Canadian side Forge FC is 0-0-4 all-time in the tournament after falling to Guadalajara, 2-1, on Feb. 13.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Pumas UNAM returns to the tournament for the first time since 2022; Cavalry FC is 0-0-2 all-time in the tournament after suffering a 3-1 setback to MLS side Orlando City in the second leg of their first-round matchup in 2024.

programme.title: CONCACAF Champions League Soccer
programme.desc: Mexican club Guadalajara is 2-0-0 all-time against Dominican side Cibao after earning a 5-0 victory in the second leg of their Round of 16 matchup in the 2018 edition, as Carlos Cisneros scored and added an assist in the second half.

programme.title: Copa America 2024: Argentina's Road to Glory
NASCAR Race Classic
programme.desc: Jeff Gordon was coming off his second Cup Series title in three years, including a win at the 1997 Daytona 500, while seven-time Cup Series champion Dale Earnhardt sought his first win at the prestigious race that continued to elude him.

programme.title: LIV Golf
programme.desc: Teams compete in the 54-hole, season-opening event, as golfers play under the lights at night for a $25 million purse in the first-ever LIV Golf tournament held in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia; Jon Rahm (individual) and Ripper GC (team) won 2024 titles.

programme.title: 2025 Concacaf Men's U-17 Qualifiers
programme.desc: Curaçao U17 was outscored, 21-3, in its three matches in the 2023 edition; Bermuda U17 has split two all-time meetings with Curaçao after earning a 4-0 victory in a group stage match at the 2001 edition jointly held by Honduras and the United States.

programme.desc: Top contenders Kyle Troup, Anthony Simonsen, Jason Belmonte, EJ Tackett and Bill O'Neill featured in the 2024 U.S. Open's championship round; Graham Fach comes off of returning to the winner's circle at the Delaware Classic in Middletown, Delaware.

programme.title: Saudi Pro League Soccer
programme.desc: Al-Nassr claimed a 4-1 victory over Al-Fayha in their first meeting of the season on Aug. 27, led by a brace from Anderson Talisca after 96 minutes; Cirstiano Ronaldo added a goal and an assist for Al-Nassr in the first half of the away win.

programme.title: College Basketball
programme.desc: No. 12 St. John's (20-3, 11-1) won nine-straight games behind RJ Luis Jr., who is fourth in the Big East with 17.4 ppg; No. 19 UConn (16-6, 8-3) is 10-1 at home, and won its last four meetings with the Red Storm after taking all three last season.

programme.title: The Masters Agility Championship at Westminster
programme.desc: Over 300 dogs compete in two qualifying rounds consisting of a Standard Agility and a Jumper with Weaves course, with the 10 dogs with the highest combined scores from each of the five height classes advancing; Truant, a Border Collie, won last year.

programme.title: Bassmasters
programme.desc: The top anglers across the country compete in a series of annual events that makes up bass fishing's most competitive league, featuring millions of dollars in prizes, tournaments taking place throughout the U.S., and coverage of all the major phases.
